Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction and the Committee on Criminal Justice

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction and the Committee on Criminal Justice
Oversight - Correctional Health
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to report on information regarding sick call and clinic production and share such information with correctional health services, and to repeal section 9-108 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to health services for incarcerated individuals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOC to report on information regarding sick call and clinic production and share such information with correctional health services, and to repeal section 9-108 of the administrative code, relating to health services for incarcerated individ

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.08673/A.8774A, which would require that State correctional facilities provide incarcerated individuals with access to methadone, buprenorphine, and naltrexone for the duration of incarceration.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require that State correctional facilities provide incarcerated individuals with access to methadone, buprenorphine, and naltrexone for the duration of incarceration. (S.08673/A.8774A)

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Powers, Van Bramer, Holden, Lancman, Cabrera and Ampry-Samuel

Items.Title: Oversight - Correctional Health
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to report on information regarding sick call and clinic production and share such information with correctional health services, and to repeal section 9-108 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to health services for incarcerated individuals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOC to report on information regarding sick call and clinic production and share such information with correctional health services, and to repeal section 9-108 of the administrative code, relating to health services for incarcerated individ

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.08673/A.8774A, which would require that State correctional facilities provide incarcerated individuals with access to methadone, buprenorphine, and naltrexone for the duration of incarceration.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Require that State correctional facilities provide incarcerated individuals with access to methadone, buprenorphine, and naltrexone for the duration of incarceration. (S.08673/A.8774A)
